chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: In the previous presentation, I explained

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: how to perform the addition of two or more continuous time

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: signals.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: In this lecture, we will perform the multiplication.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: We multiply amplitudes of two or more signals

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: at each instant of time to get their product.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: Let's say the two signals are x1t and x2t,

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: and we want to multiply the two signals.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: And let's say the resultant signal is x3t,

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: which is equal to x1t multiplied with x2t.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: And to find out x3t, we need to multiply the amplitude of x1t

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: with the amplitude of x2t at each instant of time.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: When time t is less than or equal to 2,

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: and when it is greater than 1, then signal x1t

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: is having amplitude equal to minus 1.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: You can see from 1 to 2, x1t is equal to minus 1.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: And signal x2t during this time interval is equal to 2.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: Therefore, the resultant signal x3t is equal to minus 2,

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: because minus 1 multiplied with 2 is equal to minus 2.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: Now we will find out the resultant signal x3t

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: when time t is less than or equal to 1,

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: but it is greater than 0.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: During this time interval, signal x1t is equal to 2,

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: and signal x2t is equal to 1.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: Therefore, x3t is equal to 2.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: Now we will find out the resultant signal when time t

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: is less than or equal to 0, but it is greater than minus 1.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: And during this time interval, x1t is equal to 2,

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: and x2t is equal to minus 1.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: Therefore, x3t is equal to minus 2.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: And when time is less than or equal to minus 1,

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: but it is greater than minus 2, signal x1t is equal to 1,

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: and signal x2t is equal to minus 1.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: Therefore, the resultant signal is equal to minus 1.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: And when time is less than or equal to minus 2,

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: but it is greater than minus 3, signal x1t is equal to 0.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: You can see it is equal to 0.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: And as we are performing the multiplication,

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: if any one signal is equal to 0, the resultant signal

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: will also become 0.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: Now we will find out the resultant signal

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: when time t is less than or equal to minus 3.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: Signal x1t is equal to 0.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: You can see it is equal to 0.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: And therefore, x3t will also become 0.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: There is no need to find signal x2t in both these cases

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: because x1t is equal to 0.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: Now using this information, we will plot signal x3t.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: We will plot the resultant signal x3t.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: When time t is equal to 2, resultant signal

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: is equal to minus 2.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: When time t is equal to 2, the resultant signal

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: is equal to minus 2.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: And also when time t is greater than 1

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: but it is less than or equal to 2,

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: the resultant signal is equal to minus 2.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: So we have plot like this.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: When time t is equal to 1, the resultant signal is equal to 2.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: So when t is equal to 1, x3t is equal to 2.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: I will join these two points.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: In the same way, you have to complete the plot using

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: the remaining conditions.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: And this is the final plot of the resultant signal, x3t.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: This is all for this lecture.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: I hope you now know how to multiply two or more continuous time signals.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: In the next lecture, I will explain the scaling operation.

chunks.Title: Multiplication of Continuous-Time Signals
chunks.Text: So see you in the next lecture.
